questions.question: Of the following, which is the most common cause of workplace injury for young workers in BC?

choices.answer: Working under the influence of drugs or alcohol
All are equally common causes of workplace injury

questions.question: Workers are at the greatest risk of being seriously injured within the first 6 mths on the job.
If you believe a work procedure or tool to be unsafe, what must you do?

choices.answer: Refuse to do the procedure or use the tool
Communicate your concerns with your supervisor

questions.question: The right of a worker to refuse unsafe work is guaranteed in the OHS Regulation.
It is your responsibility as a worker to work without undue risk to yourself or others.
It is your responsibility as a worker to correct unsafe conditions or report it right away.
It is your responsibility as a worker to ensure that your co-workers are properly trained.
It is your responsibility as a worker to know how to handle any hazardous materials on the job.
Only workplaces with 5 or more employees are required to conduct new worker safety training.
Which of the following does NOT need to be included as part of new worker training?

choices.answer: Specific hazards to which the worker may be exposed
How to perform basic first aid procedures

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT considered an employer’s right and responsibility?

choices.answer: Ensure the health and safety of workers
Expect workers to always follow health and safety procedures
Deduct 50% of the cost of training from workers’ pay
Establish occupational health and safety policies & programs

questions.question: Which of the following are considered a supervisor’s rights and responsibilities?

choices.answer: Know the WorkSafeBC requirements that apply to the work
Ensure PPE/clothing is available and maintained
Investigate unsafe conditions reported to them immediately

questions.question: Apprentices are not subject to the Workers Compensation Act and the OHS Regulation.
The maximum height you can work at without using fall protection is 3 metres.
The minimum age for the designated first aid attendant required at all worksites is 18 yrs old.
Your employer is required to provide you with appropriate safety headgear (e.g., hard hat).
Bullying at work is considered an internal workplace matter. It is not covered by WorkSafeBC.
What safeguards must an employer have for workers working alone or in isolation late at night ?

choices.answer: Good visibility into and out of the premises
